intro: Plectocomia lorzingii, commonly known as the Zambian lily, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude grasslands of Zambia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically blooms during the dry season, showcasing its ornamental value in arid environments. Its botanical features include strap-like leaves and a unique inflorescence that attracts pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
